title: BBC Local Live: Norfolk on Tuesday, 8 March 2016 - BBC News
summary: plans to build 200 homes at the former pontins holiday centre at hemsby are recommended for approval by councillors tonight .
engineers continue repair work to a burst water main in great yarmouth .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on wednesday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: thanks for joining us for norfolk live .
we 'll be back tomorrow 08:00 bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather updates from across the county .
you can get in touch with us on email , facebook or twitter .

documents.title: weather : cloudy with light rain
text: a cloudy evening , with light rain or drizzle .
becoming wet and windy .
temperatures falling to 4c ( 39f ) .
a wet and windy day , with heavy rain easing later .
temperatures reaching 7c ( 45f ) .
there 's more information on bbc weather .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: your sunrise in norfolk
text: what a contrast to yesterday morning , when a carpet of snow spread itself across norfolk .
weather watcher kim captured this photograph of the sunrise today .
if you have a photograph that you 'd like to share with us , you can send it to us on email .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: new ct scanner to reduce waiting times
text: a new temporary ct scanner has been installed at the norfolk and norwich university hospital to help cut down patient waiting times .
the unit , situated in front of the urgent care centre , will be in place for six months and will be used by more than 30 patients a day for cancer and diagnostic scans .
chief operating officer richard parker says it will help in the short term to speed up the care and treatment of patients .
the hospital has been taking steps to reduce waiting times for diagnostic procedures .

documents.title: the headlines : decision due on plans for homes at former holiday camp workers repairing burst water main remove section of pipe
text: the stories in the news today :

documents.title: norfolk senior cup semi-final is on
text: king 's lynn town reserves take on dereham town for a place in the norfolk senior cup final tonight .
norwich united await the winners .
the linnets ' game against hungerford on saturday was postponed due to a waterlogged pitch but the walks surface has been deemed playable for tonight 's game .
author: Rob Butler
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: paw patrols 'invaluable ' in fight against crime
text: there are 47 police dogs and 25 handlers in norfolk and suffolk 's joint dog unit , providing specialist support to colleagues to help keep both counties safe .
last year , the team made more than 1,170 arrests , carried out more than 1,500 drug searches and helped find 347 missing people .
earlier the team posted this video on twitter :
paw patrols are invaluable in the fight against crime read more > > >
@ twitterid @ twitterid fascinating .
wish you had time to tweet more often .
poor pd ozzy .
rip no baddies in heaven .

documents.title: watch : starlings take flight over norwich
text: as the sun sets over the norwich skyline , an amazing sight can be seen .
hundreds of starlings take flight , forming a `` murmuration '' , wheeling in formation over the city centre .
many thanks to fabian harrison for sending us this video .

documents.title: beales ' diss store safe
text: landlords of loss-making shops in the beales department store group are being asked to lower rents or take back their properties .
author: Diss Express

documents.title: councillors urge rethink on parking meters scheme for cromer and sheringham
text: north norfolk district council has sent a statement from its members to officers of the norfolk parking partnership joint committee setting out the authority 's concerns at controversial plans to introduce on-street parking meters to cromer and sheringham .
councillor nigel pearce says he feels the proposals would be `` robbing the norfolk coast taking money out of the area and not bringing benefits to the two seaside towns . ''
councillor judy oliver says the council would look to challenge the proposal in court if it 's pushed through .
the partnership says the financial sustainability of civil parking enforcement in norfolk depends on additional revenue from such schemes .

documents.title: medieval monument to be restored
text: a medieval stone monument in the heart of norfolk is being reinstated after it was broken in pieces when a car crashed into it in 2013 .
norfolk county council has brought in a specialist firm to undertake the work to the old stump cross at haveringland , near reepham .
when put back together , the 500-year old monument will stand about 5ft ( 1.5m ) tall .
author: Tim Addicott
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: updates on road closures for construction of northern distributor road
text: a main road to the east of norwich , which has been closed since 22 february for preparatory work ahead of construction of a double bridge for the norwich northern distributor road ( ndr ) , is to reopen .
plumstead road , which has been closed between thorpe end and little plumstead , is set to reopen by the evening of friday .
on monday , the nearby middle road will close until 25 march , followed by the closures of smee lane from 28 march and low road .
from 11 april .
the long-term closure of drayton lane , on the western half of the ndr , begins on monday , with holly lane providing a diversion route .
the lane , a popular cut-through between reepham road and the b1149 holt road , is to be realigned to provide a new route for holt road traffic to the ndr .

documents.title: watch : conductor is new voice of train company
text: senior conductor stephen carlyle-hearn has been chosen as the new voice of east midlands trains .
mr carlyle-hearn , from norwich , will be heard on pre-recorded announcements at all the rail company 's stations .
he says it 's a real privilege to be chosen , and that he had great fun recording the announcements .

documents.title: engineers remove damaged water main
text: engineers from essex and suffolk water worked throughout the night to repair a burst water main in great yarmouth .
a 4.5m ( 14.7ft ) section of the burst pipe was removed .
traffic is restricted to one lane on south quay , and gorleston-bound traffic can not use the south quay or haven bridge .
road restrictions are likely to remain in place until the weekend .

documents.title: norwich : a vibrant city
text: norwich is among the five most vibrant smaller cities in the uk , according to a new report .
the report , by the centre for cities think tank , says norwich , cambridge , oxford , milton keynes and swindon have higher productivity levels than bigger cities such as manchester and birmingham .
they also have higher than average levels of employment and business start-ups , and are among the fastest growing in terms of population .
however , the report warns that without government help , challenges such as housing , increasing traffic congestion and skills gaps could halt the progress in its tracks .
author: Nanette Aldous
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: cannabis 'should be available in specialist shops , ' says mp
text: the north norfolk mp norman lamb is leading calls by the liberal democrats to allow specialist shops to sell cannabis .
he says it could raise over £ 1bn a year in tax revenue for the government .
the party also says over-18s should be allowed to grow cannabis at home for personal use .
mr lamb , lib dem health spokesman , said it had to be better than the current policy where `` vast amounts of police time and resources are wasted going after those using the drug '' .

documents.title: norwich cathedral science fest 's explosive start
text: there was an explosive start to a two-week science festival at norwich cathedral last night when a replica volcano erupted just outside the historic venue .
author: Network Norfolk

documents.title: walsh 's next challenger confirmed
text: cromer 's british featherweight champion ryan walsh will make the second defence of his title on 30 april .
he will face northern irishman james tennyson ( london 's copper box arena .
author: Rob Butler
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: coast protection work begins
text: maintenance work on the shingle embankment and beach between snettisham and hunstanton is set to begin today .

ryan ely , flood and coastal risk adviser for the environment agency , says the moving of more than 5,000 cubic metres of sand and shingle from the snettisham scalp to reinforce the defences is the most sustainable way to protect the coast .
nearly 3,000 properties are protected from tidal flooding by the embankment .
the work , costing about £ 150,000 , will take three weeks and is being carried out before the start of the bird breeding season .

documents.title: watch : councillors to consider homes plan for former holiday camp
text: controversial plans to build 200 new homes on the site of the former pontins holiday camp in hemsby are likely to get the go-ahead .
there 's been strong opposition to the housing since the resort closed eight years ago .
a decision will be made by councillors this evening .

documents.title: chris sutton : 'norwich just are n't good enough '
text: with norwich city currently 18th in the premier league , former striker chris sutton pulled no punches when discussing their chances of avoiding relegation on bbc 5 live 's monday night club .
`` i think norwich are where they should be .
i do n't think they are underachieving - i just do n't think they are good enough , '' he said .
you can hear the full clip below :
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: make mine a double , demands city boss
text: the back page of the norwich evening news :
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: police 'co-operating fully ' with ipcc over complaint
text: norfolk police says it is `` co-operating fully '' with the independent police complaints commission investigation following a complaint about the conduct of one of its officers at a school for pupils with special education needs .
the spokesman for norfolk police said the incident happened on 3 december 2015 , and its professional standards department received a complaint on 17 december .
the matter was then referred to the ipcc .
ipcc associate commissioner tom milsom said the allegations were `` serious , involving the officer 's interaction with a vulnerable boy '' and that it would be conducting a thorough investigation .

documents.title: investigation into conduct of police officer
text: the independent police complaints commission ( ipcc ) has begun an independent investigation following a complaint about the conduct of a norfolk police officer at a school for pupils with special educational needs .
the mother of a 14-year-old pupil raised concerns that a police constable had used abusive and discriminatory language towards her son while at the school in december 2015 .
the investigation will also examine an allegation that the officer used excessive force when arresting the boy during the incident .

documents.title: former holiday camp plan 'could bring much-needed housing and investment '
text: a former holiday camp in hemsby could be used for housing if a planning application for 200 homes is approved , despite objections from the parish council and local people .
northern trust , the owners of the site of the former pontins resort , says the development would being `` much-needed housing and investment into the area for the benefit of the local economy . ''
people living nearby have raised concerns that the plans would create a dormitory suburb for commuters and that the local infrastructure wo n't be able to cope .
many have said it still has tourist potential .

documents.title: bid to save a hidden gem
text: the front page of the norwich evening news :
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: picture : engineers install new water pipe in great yarmouth
text: essex and suffolk water engineers are working to fix a burst water main in great yarmouth .
here 's a tweet from the company :
here 's the # water pipe we 've installed overnight in # gtyarmouth # norfolk - securing supplies @ twitterid @ twitterid
i am not impressed by your photo of a plastic pipe @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid what about repairing the hole in the road you made ?
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid we are working to re-instate the road once the repair work is completed - oliver @ twitterid

text: the back page of the eastern daily press :
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: drug-driver faces custody
text: the front page of the eastern daily press :
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: source of burst water main has been located
text: engineers from essex and suffolk water say they have found the source of flooding in great yarmouth .
a 4.5m ( 14.7ft ) section of the burst water main has been cut out and removed , and work to repair the pipe continues .
the a1243 south quay remains closed between the haven bridge and yarmouth way junction .
oliver rogers , from the water company , said it was a difficult job and he expected roads to be affected by diversions until the weekend .

documents.title: canaries hopeful on brady and naismith injuries
text: norwich city manager alex neil is expecting robbie brady and steven naismith to take part in their relegation fight .
both players limped out of the canaries ' latest defeat at swansea .
left-back brady suffered a calf injury in the first half with naismith going off with a hamstring problem just after norwich had conceded the game 's only goal .
neil said : `` i think both felt it and i 'm hoping they 've come off before it 's got any worse . ''
city have already lost midfielder alex tettey to injury for the rest of the season .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: traffic information for great yarmouth
text: motorists in great yarmouth are facing travel disruption while repair works on a burst water main continue .
norfolk county council engineers are liaising with essex and suffolk water , and expect the disruption to last at least until the weekend .
council engineers will decide later this week whether a planned closure this weekend of nottingham way will go ahead .

documents.title: warning to motorists : take care on icy roads
text: east anglia : ice is a real hazard this morning given wet surfaces following showers over recent days , and subzero temps .
take care on roads .

documents.title: councillors expected to approve plans for homes on former holiday camp
text: councillors are expected to approve plans to build 200 new homes on a disused holiday camp in norfolk tonight .
great yarmouth councillors are expected to give the go-ahead for the scheme for the former pontins holiday centre at hemsby , despite objections from the parish council and local residents .
there has been an eight-year fight against housing at the holiday camp since in closed in 2008 .

documents.title: weather : mostly dry and bright
text: after a chilly and frosty start , it will be a dry day with some sunny spells .
cloudy , thickening later , with a few outbreaks of light rain .
maximum temperature : 7c ( 45f ) .
staying cloudy tonight , with heavy rain spreading across the county by dawn .
minimum temperature : 4c ( 39f ) .
there 's more information on bbc weather .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome to norfolk live
text: thanks for joining us for tuesday 's norfolk live .
we 'll have your news , sport , travel and weather updates for the county from now until 18:00 .
if there 's something happening where you live that you 'd like to share with us , or maybe you have a photograph , you can get in touch via email , twitter or facebook .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live
